Code Block Examples in Different Languages

This post showcases code snippets in various programming languages.

Python Example

def greet(name):
    print(f"Hello, {name}!")

greet("Himangshu")

JavaScript Example

function greet(name) {
    console.log(`Hello, ${name}!`);
}

greet("Himangshu");

C++ Example

#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

void greet(string name) {
    cout << "Hello, " << name << "!" << endl;
}

int main() {
    greet("Himangshu");
    return 0;
}

Rust Example

fn greet(name: &str) {
    println!("Hello, {}!", name);
}

fn main() {
    greet("Himangshu");
}

Solidity Example

// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

contract Greeter {
    function greet() public pure returns (string memory) {
        return "Hello, Himangshu!";
    }
}

Go Example

package main
import "fmt"

func greet(name string) {
    fmt.Println("Hello,", name)
}

func main() {
    greet("Himangshu")
}

Java Example

public class Main {
    public static void greet(String name) {
        System.out.println("Hello, " + name + "!");
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        greet("Himangshu");
    }
}

Bash Script Example

#!/bin/bash
greet() {
    echo "Hello, $1!"
}
greet "Himangshu"

SQL Example

SELECT name FROM users WHERE name = 'Himangshu';

HTML + CSS Example

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <style>
        body { background: black; color: lime; }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <h1>Hello, Himangshu!</h1>
</body>
</html>

YAML Example

title: "Code Block Examples"
author: "Himangshu Pan"
date: "2025-03-31"
categories:
  - coding
  - programming

JSON Example

{
  "title": "Code Block Examples",
  "author": "Himangshu Pan",
  "date": "2025-03-31",
  "categories": ["coding", "programming"]
}

Markdown Example

# Hello, World!
This is a **Markdown** example.

Dockerfile Example

FROM rust:1.71
WORKDIR /app
COPY . .
RUN cargo build --release
CMD ["./target/release/myapp"]

Makefile Example

build:
	cargo build --release

run:
	./target/release/myapp

PowerShell Example

function Greet($name) {
    Write-Output "Hello, $name!"
}

Greet "Himangshu"

Conclusion

This post contains code blocks for various programming languages. Jekyll will automatically apply syntax highlighting.
